channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump tariffs fallout: China retaliates, Vietnam talks, U.S. markets melt down
item.description: China retaliated against Trump's tariffs with its own 34% levy. U.S. markets dropped on the news.

item.title: Nasdaq and Russell 2000 are now in a bear market. What history says comes next.
Investors are not panicking, trading index shows. That might be a bad thing.
Stocks see biggest 2-day wipeout ever, with $11 trillion lost since inauguration
Trump tariffs are 'pure madness' and the European Union should not comply, former Italian PM says
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's so-called 'Liberation Day' trade tariffs are "madness, pure madness", according to former Italian Prime Minister Enrico ...

item.title: Trump open to tariff negotiations, contradicting White House aides
item.description: Trump's tariff fallout starts with layoffs, price hikes and trade war tensions, driving a broad market sell-off.

item.title: Judge jails Trump clemency recipient Jonathan Braun after child assault arrest
item.description: Jonathan Braun's family used connections it had to the family of Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, to set in motion the clemency from the president.

item.title: Trump is calling for a Fed rate cut to rescue markets. Why he might be right.
Congress has power over tariffs, but stopping Trump isn't likely as of now
item.description: Stock market indices have sharply fallen on the heels of President Trump imposing higher tariffs on more than 180 countries.

item.title: Dow slides 2,200 points as stocks seal historic rout spurred by Trumpâ€™s tariffs
